overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on topics related to computational social science, disinformation, and research opportunities. His LinkedIn account boasts the largest follower base, while engagement varies across platforms depending on content type and platform norms.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to computational methods for social media analysis and detection of coordinated campaigns.
Content focusing on the study of disinformation, information operations, and coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Posts advertising research grants, postdoctoral positions, and PhD student opportunities in related fields.

recommendations: Diversify content formats (e.g., videos, infographics) to increase engagement.
Tailor content to each platform's audience and style.
Increase posting frequency, especially on less active platforms like Mastodon.
Engage more actively with followers by responding to comments and questions.
Use relevant hashtags to increase content discoverability.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky demonstrates solid engagement through reposts and likes, indicating a receptive audience for research publications and conference announcements. Focus on sharing early research findings and actively participating in relevant conversations.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon has a smaller audience with relatively lower engagement compared to other platforms. Experiment with more interactive content and participate actively in relevant communities on the instance.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn shows high engagement with announcements about grants and job openings. Continue sharing professional updates, research achievements, and career opportunities to leverage the platform's professional audience.
